item.title: anthroposemiotics
item.description: field of study dedicated to understanding how humans communicate The evolution of human communication took place over a long period of time from simple hand gestures to the use of spoken language

item.title: mass communication
item.description: process of imparting and exchanging information through mass media to large population segments. It utilizes various forms of media as technology has made the dissemination of information more efficient.

item.title: Wiio's Laws
item.description: a set of humorous aphorisms that describe how communication often fails or leads to misunderstanding named after Osmo Wiio, a Finnish professor and politician, who formulated them in 1978.

item.title: Argument to Moderation
item.description: logical fallacy that assumes that the truth is always a compromise between two opposite positions. It is also known as false compromise, argument from middle ground, or the golden mean fallacy.

item.title: Communication
item.description: Communication is a two-way process where information is exchanged or passed from one person to another person. The word is derived from ‘communicare’ which means to impart.
